data: A lexical resource built upon WordNet, assigning sentiment scores (objective, positive, negative) to individual word senses (synsets).

Contains nearly 5,000 text snippets, collected from financial news and press releases of Finnish companies listed on the NASDAQ OMX Nordic Exchange. Each snippet is labeled as positive, negative, or neutral.
A dataset used for understanding sentiment in financial texts, combining artificial intelligence and semantic network techniques to better identify, interpret, and process opinions in this context.

Introduces entity-sentiment annotation to address the challenge of titles containing multiple entities that may have conflicting sentiments. This manually annotated dataset of over 10,700 news headlines provides insights into the sentiment changes of specific entities in financial news.

A dataset of tokenized and annotated Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) speeches, meeting minutes, and press conference transcripts. This resource aims to understand the impact of monetary policy on financial markets by analyzing the language used by the central bank.

An annotated financial document relation dataset, containing approximately 29,000 instances and 22 relation types, covering eight entity pairs (e.g., Person-Position, Organization-Money), extracted from SEC 10-X filings. Suitable for identifying relationships between entities in financial reports.
Compiled from multiple news sources and evaluated by human experts, allowing researchers to explore how news headlines affect price volatility, asset comparison, and other financial events.
A Named Entity Recognition (NER) dataset specifically designed for the financial domain, useful for identifying and classifying financial companies in text data.

Provides a multilingual financial NLP dataset containing real-world financial article headlines in 15 languages. High-level and low-level topics are annotated, facilitating multi-class and multi-label classification tasks.

A collection of question-answer pairs that perform in-depth analysis of financial reports. Written by financial experts, it focuses on deep reasoning over financial data, providing training data for answering complex financial questions.
